main event: An observer reported seeing a bullet-shaped object, shimmering gold and very bright, while driving near Mount Prospect, Illinois on May 20, 1958.
interesting points: The object was seen for about 2 minutes while the observer was driving into the sun, which may have caused an optical illusion., It was described as the size of a quarter and stationary during the observation., The report concluded possibilities of it being a balloon or an astronomical phenomenon., Other reports suggest it might relate to the latest Russian satellite or its propellant assembly., There were no confirmed aircraft in the area at the time of the sighting.
